carousel_items: Lowers bad cholesterol and triglycerides, and raises good cholesterol.
Avoid grapefruit and grapefruit juice while taking this medicine.
Tell your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, fever or weakness.
Tell your doctor if you notice dark urine or yellowing of the eyes or skin.

clock.tip: Works faster on an empty stomach.

basics.benefits_moa: Atorvastatin is cholesterol-lowering medicine called a statin. It lowers the amount of cholesterol your body makes, which helps lower "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and raise "good" cholesterol (HDL).
basics.bottom_line: Atorvastatin is a good medication to improve your cholesterol. Statin side effects can be difficult to deal with, but the benefits might outweigh the risks.
downsides: Statins can cause digestive problems, blood sugar problems, muscle aches and stiffness, muscle injury, kidney damage, and liver damage. Some people have to stop taking this medicine because of these problems.

You're at higher risk for these side effects if you are female, are 65 years or older, drink alcohol every day, take more than one medicine for cholesterol, or have liver disease, kidney disease, or diabetes.
Eating a lot of grapefruit can raise your risk of liver damage.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

downsides_processed.orig: Statins can cause digestive problems, blood sugar problems, muscle aches and stiffness, muscle injury, kidney damage, and liver damage. Some people have to stop taking this medicine because of these problems.

You're at higher risk for these side effects if you are female, are 65 years or older, drink alcohol every day, take more than one medicine for cholesterol, or have liver disease, kidney disease, or diabetes.
Eating a lot of grapefruit can raise your risk of liver damage.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

upsides: Lowers "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and triglycerides (fats) and raises "good" cholesterol (HDL) in people who have trouble doing this through diet and exercise.
Can lower the risk of heart attack, stroke, and death, particularly if you have diabetes, high blood pressure, obesity, or a history of smoking.
One of the strongest cholesterol-lowering statin medications.
A good option for people who have high cholesterol and diabetes.

upsides_processed.orig: Lowers "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and triglycerides (fats) and raises "good" cholesterol (HDL) in people who have trouble doing this through diet and exercise.
Can lower the risk of heart attack, stroke, and death, particularly if you have diabetes, high blood pressure, obesity, or a history of smoking.
One of the strongest cholesterol-lowering statin medications.
A good option for people who have high cholesterol and diabetes.

userStories.tip: Build up over months caused leg cramps; tired legs and shortness of breath when going up stairs.
Great for my libido

userStories.identifier: active doing line dancing and walking

userStories.tip: Had no idea it would alter my ability to process carbs without elevating my sugar levels. Caused major foot pain a few times, also some muscle aches from time to time.
it was good
take it at night
Lowered my cholesterol right away but caused increasing, radiating pain down the left side. Pain stopped as soon as I stopped taking the med, so not a good match for me.

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
Not worth it, thinking about stopping

userStories.tip: I am a long distance bicyclist and have always been active. I have Familial hyper-cholesterolemia, which  is a genetic disorder caused by a defect on chromosome 19. I have tried alternatives but Rx lowered my cholesterol 400 to 200.

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: I felt awful all the time. Major flatulence and achy all over. Stopped taking it.
Annoying muscle pain about 3X over ten years, each time in a different muscle zone, which can be discouraging. Hot showers, working pressure pts. = relief.

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping

userStories.identifier: retired, peripheral artery disease and s

userStories.tip: I had a moderate Cholesterol. This medication brought it down to normal levels. I am using it as a short cut to avoid worrying about what I eat. I am not a foodie, don't eat fast foods, so I had very limited choice for diet control.

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: Actually stopped. Taking it made me feel like I'd been hit by a Mack truck. Didn't lower my cholesterol. I feel so much better after stopping. I won't ever take it again.
Take with food
hardest part was establishing the habit to take it before going to sleep. Still rely on Mango app as reminder.

userStories.identifier: In good health, so to be retired

userStories.tip: Take as prescribed and hooray for generics!

drugs.name: Atorvastatin

labeled_indications.indication: Heart protection for people with high risk

carousel_items_processed.orig: Lowers bad cholesterol and triglycerides, and raises good cholesterol.
Avoid grapefruit and grapefruit juice while taking this medicine.
Tell your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, fever or weakness.
Tell your doctor if you notice dark urine or yellowing of the eyes or skin.

risks_warnings.title: Muscle pain
risks_warnings.description: People on Atorvastatin have reported muscle pain which may lead to muscle and kidney damage. This has been very rare. Talk to your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain or weakness or fever and you don't know why.

description_processed.orig: People on Atorvastatin have reported muscle pain which may lead to muscle and kidney damage. This has been very rare. Talk to your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain or weakness or fever and you don't know why.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: Liver damage has been reported in people who take Atorvastatin. If you notice dark urine or yellowing of the eyes or skin, talk to your prescriber. Your doctor may monitor your liver periodically.
risk_factors: Prior history of chronic liver disease

description_processed.orig: Liver damage has been reported in people who take Atorvastatin. If you notice dark urine or yellowing of the eyes or skin, talk to your prescriber. Your doctor may monitor your liver periodically.

risks_warnings.title: Birth defects
risks_warnings.description: Let your doctor know if you are planning to become or are pregnant, as Atorvastatin may cause birth defects, including death of the fetus. Your doctor may discuss alternatives to help lower your cholesterol.

description_processed.orig: Let your doctor know if you are planning to become or are pregnant, as Atorvastatin may cause birth defects, including death of the fetus. Your doctor may discuss alternatives to help lower your cholesterol.

risks_warnings.title: Urinary tract infections
risks_warnings.description: People on Atorvastatin have reported getting urinary tract infections more often. Talk to your doctor if you develop burning or pain while urinating.

description_processed.orig: People on Atorvastatin have reported getting urinary tract infections more often. Talk to your doctor if you develop burning or pain while urinating.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk of colds and flu
risks_warnings.description: People on Atorvastatin have reported getting colds or flu more often. Talk to your doctor if this bothers you.

description_processed.orig: People on Atorvastatin have reported getting colds or flu more often. Talk to your doctor if this bothers you.

carousel_items: Lowers bad cholesterol and triglycerides, and raises good cholesterol.
Most people reach their target cholesterol levels in 4 to 6 weeks.
Avoid grapefruit and grapefruit juice while taking this medicine.
Tell your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, fever, or weakness.
Tell your doctor if you notice dark urine or yellowing of the eyes or skin.
Certain medications can interact with this drug. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist.

basics.benefits_moa: Simvastatin is cholesterol-lowering medicine called a statin. It lowers the amount of cholesterol your body makes, which helps lower "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and raise "good" cholesterol (HDL).
basics.bottom_line: Simvastatin is a good medication to improve your cholesterol. Statin side effects can be difficult to deal with, but the benefits might outweigh the risks.
downsides: Statins can cause digestive problems, blood sugar problems, muscle aches and stiffness, muscle injury, kidney damage, and liver damage. Some people have to stop taking this medicine because of these problems.

You're at higher risk for these side effects if you are female, are 65 years or older, drink alcohol every day, take more than one medicine for cholesterol, or have liver disease, kidney disease, or diabetes.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

downsides_processed.orig: Statins can cause digestive problems, blood sugar problems, muscle aches and stiffness, muscle injury, kidney damage, and liver damage. Some people have to stop taking this medicine because of these problems.

You're at higher risk for these side effects if you are female, are 65 years or older, drink alcohol every day, take more than one medicine for cholesterol, or have liver disease, kidney disease, or diabetes.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

upsides: Lowers "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and triglycerides (fats) and raises "good" cholesterol (HDL) in people who have trouble doing this through diet and exercise.
Can lower the risk of heart attack, stroke, and death, particularly if you have diabetes, high blood pressure, obesity, or a history of smoking.

upsides_processed.orig: Lowers "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and triglycerides (fats) and raises "good" cholesterol (HDL) in people who have trouble doing this through diet and exercise.
Can lower the risk of heart attack, stroke, and death, particularly if you have diabetes, high blood pressure, obesity, or a history of smoking.

my numbers look better and I can only attribute those results to this drug. I did nothing differently.

drugs.name: Simvastatin

labeled_indications.indication: Heart protection for people with high risk

carousel_items_processed.orig: Lowers bad cholesterol and triglycerides, and raises good cholesterol.
Most people reach their target cholesterol levels in 4 to 6 weeks.
Avoid grapefruit and grapefruit juice while taking this medicine.
Tell your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, fever, or weakness.
Tell your doctor if you notice dark urine or yellowing of the eyes or skin.
Certain medications can interact with this drug. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist.

risks_warnings.title: Muscle pain
risks_warnings.description: There are rare cases of muscle damage leading to kidney failure in people taking Simvastatin. The risk is greater in people with kidney disease or thyroid disease, are older and female and taking certain cholesterol-lowering medication combinations. Tell your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, weakness or fever and there is no known cause.
risk_factors: Combining Simvastatin with certain cholesterol-lowering drugs

description_processed.orig: There are rare cases of muscle damage leading to kidney failure in people taking Simvastatin. The risk is greater in people with kidney disease or thyroid disease, are older and female and taking certain cholesterol-lowering medication combinations. Tell your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, weakness or fever and there is no known cause.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: There are reports of liver damage in people who take Simvastatin, especially if they are heavy alcohol drinkers or have a history of liver disease. If you notice dark urine or yellowing of the eyes or skin, tell your doctor. Your doctor may also want to check your liver function periodically.

description_processed.orig: There are reports of liver damage in people who take Simvastatin, especially if they are heavy alcohol drinkers or have a history of liver disease. If you notice dark urine or yellowing of the eyes or skin, tell your doctor. Your doctor may also want to check your liver function periodically.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Don't use while pregnant it can harm your unborn baby. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

description_processed.orig: Don't use while pregnant it can harm your unborn baby. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

risks_warnings.title: Drug interactions
risks_warnings.description: Combining certain medications can increase the risk of muscle pain (myopathy), muscle damage (rhabdomyolysis) and kidney damage. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist when taking any new medications.
risk_factors: Certain drugs can increase the dose of Simvastatin in the body

description_processed.orig: Combining certain medications can increase the risk of muscle pain (myopathy), muscle damage (rhabdomyolysis) and kidney damage. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist when taking any new medications.

risks_warnings.title: High blood sugar
risks_warnings.description: Simvastatin can increase fasting (short-term) and HbA1c (long-term) blood sugar levels. Your doctor may need to check your blood sugar levels periodically.

description_processed.orig: Simvastatin can increase fasting (short-term) and HbA1c (long-term) blood sugar levels. Your doctor may need to check your blood sugar levels periodically.

carousel_items: Lowers bad cholesterol and triglycerides, and raises good cholesterol.
Don't take antacids for at least 2 hours before and after taking this medicine.
Tell your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, fever, or weakness.
Tell your doctor if you notice dark urine or yellowing of the eyes or skin.

basics.benefits_moa: Crestor is cholesterol-lowering medicine called a statin. It lowers the amount of cholesterol your body makes, which helps lower "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and raise "good" cholesterol (HDL).
basics.bottom_line: Crestor is one of the most effective statins to improve cholesterol, but it's expensive. Statin side effects can be difficult to deal with, but the benefits might outweigh the risks.
downsides: There's no generic available, so it can be expensive.

Statins can cause digestive problems, blood sugar problems, muscle aches and stiffness, muscle injury, kidney damage, and liver damage. Some people have to stop taking this medicine because of these problems.

You're at higher risk for these side effects if you are female, are 65 years or older, drink alcohol every day, take more than one medicine for cholesterol, or have liver disease, kidney disease, or diabetes.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

downsides_processed.orig: There's no generic available, so it can be expensive.

Statins can cause digestive problems, blood sugar problems, muscle aches and stiffness, muscle injury, kidney damage, and liver damage. Some people have to stop taking this medicine because of these problems.

You're at higher risk for these side effects if you are female, are 65 years or older, drink alcohol every day, take more than one medicine for cholesterol, or have liver disease, kidney disease, or diabetes.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

upsides: Lowers "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and triglycerides (fats) and raises "good" cholesterol (HDL) in people who have trouble doing this through diet and exercise.
Slows down the buildup of fatty deposits in your blood vessels, otherwise known as hardening of the arteries.
In clinical studies, Crestor has the strongest effect on lowering "bad" cholesterol compared to other statins.
Can lower the risk of heart attack, stroke, and death, particularly if you have diabetes, high blood pressure, obesity, or a history of smoking.

upsides_processed.orig: Lowers "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and triglycerides (fats) and raises "good" cholesterol (HDL) in people who have trouble doing this through diet and exercise.
Slows down the buildup of fatty deposits in your blood vessels, otherwise known as hardening of the arteries.
In clinical studies, Crestor has the strongest effect on lowering "bad" cholesterol compared to other statins.
Can lower the risk of heart attack, stroke, and death, particularly if you have diabetes, high blood pressure, obesity, or a history of smoking.

userStories.tip: Muscle and/or joint pain was so bad I couldn't do anything.
Crestor is expensive even with part d but can,t take other statins
I slept 3 hrs every afternoon, I just went out according to friends who saw me and I became afraid to drive for fear of killing myself and others.
only problem is the price.  can't take most statins since i take erythromycin regularly for gastroparesis.
I was taking 10 mg. Had some aches in arm may or may not have been related.  Went to 5 mg. No aches. Cholesterol is good. Also worked on diet and exercise

Stopped taking it after suffering Rhabdomyolysis which attacks the muscles and kidneys.  I had no symptoms to warn me until the damage to muscles was done. Proved to be a very dangerous drug for me..Keep check of blood CK levels if using it
Taking it with evening meal helps me remember to take it

carousel_items: Using low doses (81mg) of aspirin every day can lower your risk of heart attack and stroke, but it isn't good for everyone. Only take aspirin daily if your doctor recommends it.
Higher aspirin doses can be used to treat occasional pain, swelling, and fever. Using ibuprofen or acetaminophen (Tylenol) instead can lower your risk of serious bleeding.
Take with food to lower the chance of an upset stomach.
Don't use for kids younger than 18 years old.
Stop taking this right away and tell your doctor if you have ringing in your ears, unusual bleeding, or nausea or vomiting that doesn't go away.

clock.tip: Take with food or milk to lower stomach upset.

basics.benefits_moa: Aspirin is a salicylate and non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). It blocks the inflammation process in your body, which relieves swelling and pain. It also prevents blood platelets from forming clots, which thins your blood.
basics.bottom_line: A low dose of Aspirin (81mg) every day can protect your heart, but it's not the best medicine to take for pain, swelling, or fever.
downsides: Not a preferred medication for treating pain, swelling, or fever due to its high risk of bleeding.
NSAIDs (like ibuprofen and naproxen) and acetaminophen (Tylenol) are better for treating pain and fever thank aspirin.
Aspirin raises your risk of bleeding, especially when used with other blood thinner medications like warfarin (Coumadin).
Studies show that using higher doses of Aspirin (162 mg or more) every day raises your risk of stomach bleeding and doesn't provide any additional heart protection.

downsides_processed.orig: Not a preferred medication for treating pain, swelling, or fever due to its high risk of bleeding.
NSAIDs (like ibuprofen and naproxen) and acetaminophen (Tylenol) are better for treating pain and fever thank aspirin.
Aspirin raises your risk of bleeding, especially when used with other blood thinner medications like warfarin (Coumadin).
Studies show that using higher doses of Aspirin (162 mg or more) every day raises your risk of stomach bleeding and doesn't provide any additional heart protection.

upsides: When taking low doses (81 mg) every day, aspirin provides protection for your heart and prevents heart attacks and stroke.
Used in higher doses to relieve pain, swelling, and fever.
Available over-the-counter in drugstores by itself and in combination with other cold and flu medications.

upsides_processed.orig: When taking low doses (81 mg) every day, aspirin provides protection for your heart and prevents heart attacks and stroke.
Used in higher doses to relieve pain, swelling, and fever.
Available over-the-counter in drugstores by itself and in combination with other cold and flu medications.

drugs.one_liner: Relieves pain, fever, and inflammation. Protects your heart and thins blood.

userStories.tip: research and understand the actual reason to take this medicine, as well as any medicine - than it will be helpful. Don't take it "just because". High quality Aspirin (e.g. Bayer) is much better (better effect without harming)

drugs.name: Aspirin

off-label_indications.indication: Blood clot prevention for blood vessel graft
Blood clot prevention for atrial fibrillation
Blood clot prevention for artificial heart valve
Blood clot prevention for peripheral artery disease
High blood pressure prevention for IVF pregnancy
condition_url_name: High blood pressure prevention for IVF pregnancy

carousel_items_processed.orig: Using low doses (81mg) of aspirin every day can lower your risk of heart attack and stroke, but it isn't good for everyone. Only take aspirin daily if your doctor recommends it.
Higher aspirin doses can be used to treat occasional pain, swelling, and fever. Using ibuprofen or acetaminophen (Tylenol) instead can lower your risk of serious bleeding.
Take with food to lower the chance of an upset stomach.
Don't use for kids younger than 18 years old.
Stop taking this right away and tell your doctor if you have ringing in your ears, unusual bleeding, or nausea or vomiting that doesn't go away.

risks_warnings.title: Brain damage or death from Reye's Syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Aspirin use is linked to a condition called Reye's syndrome that causes liver and brain swelling. This is rare but very serious. Let your doctor know about any nausea, vomiting, unusually low energy, or changes in behavior.

description_processed.orig: Aspirin use is linked to a condition called Reye's syndrome that causes liver and brain swelling. This is rare but very serious. Let your doctor know about any nausea, vomiting, unusually low energy, or changes in behavior.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Aspirin can cause serious problems including inflammation, bleeding, and ulcers in the stomach or intestines. The longer you take Aspirin, the higher the risk is. If you notice blood or a dark/black color in your stool, tell your doctor right away.
risk_factors: History of stomach bleeding or ulcers
Taking aspirin, NSAIDs, or blood thinners
Drinking more than 3 alcoholic beverages a day

description_processed.orig: Aspirin can cause serious problems including inflammation, bleeding, and ulcers in the stomach or intestines. The longer you take Aspirin, the higher the risk is. If you notice blood or a dark/black color in your stool, tell your doctor right away.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Aspirin can cause serious allergic reactions. These reactions can make it difficult to breathe or can cause a severe rash that can be life threatening. Get medical help immediately if you develop a skin rash, fever, swelling, or have trouble breathing.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Aspirin can cause serious allergic reactions. These reactions can make it difficult to breathe or can cause a severe rash that can be life threatening. Get medical help immediately if you develop a skin rash, fever, swelling, or have trouble breathing.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to unborn babies
risks_warnings.description: Aspirin can cause birth defects. Don't use Aspirin while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

description_processed.orig: Aspirin can cause birth defects. Don't use Aspirin while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

Annoying muscle pain about 3X over ten years, each time in a different muscle zone, which can be discouraging. Hot showers, working pressure pts. = relief.

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping

userStories.identifier: retired, peripheral artery disease and s

userStories.tip: I had a moderate Cholesterol. This medication brought it down to normal levels. I am using it as a short cut to avoid worrying about what I eat. I am not a foodie, don't eat fast foods, so I had very limited choice for diet control.

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: Actually stopped. Taking it made me feel like I'd been hit by a Mack truck. Didn't lower my cholesterol. I feel so much better after stopping. I won't ever take it again.
Take with food
hardest part was establishing the habit to take it before going to sleep. Still rely on Mango app as reminder.

userStories.identifier: In good health, so to be retired

userStories.tip: Take as prescribed and hooray for generics!

drugs.name: Atorvastatin

labeled_indications.indication: Heart protection for people with high risk

carousel_items_processed.orig: Lowers bad cholesterol and triglycerides, and raises good cholesterol.
Avoid grapefruit and grapefruit juice while taking this medicine.
Tell your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, fever or weakness.
Tell your doctor if you notice dark urine or yellowing of the eyes or skin.

risks_warnings.title: Muscle pain
risks_warnings.description: People on Atorvastatin have reported muscle pain which may lead to muscle and kidney damage. This has been very rare. Talk to your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain or weakness or fever and you don't know why.

description_processed.orig: People on Atorvastatin have reported muscle pain which may lead to muscle and kidney damage. This has been very rare. Talk to your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain or weakness or fever and you don't know why.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: Liver damage has been reported in people who take Atorvastatin. If you notice dark urine or yellowing of the eyes or skin, talk to your prescriber. Your doctor may monitor your liver periodically.
risk_factors: Prior history of chronic liver disease

description_processed.orig: Liver damage has been reported in people who take Atorvastatin. If you notice dark urine or yellowing of the eyes or skin, talk to your prescriber. Your doctor may monitor your liver periodically.

risks_warnings.title: Birth defects
risks_warnings.description: Let your doctor know if you are planning to become or are pregnant, as Atorvastatin may cause birth defects, including death of the fetus. Your doctor may discuss alternatives to help lower your cholesterol.

description_processed.orig: Let your doctor know if you are planning to become or are pregnant, as Atorvastatin may cause birth defects, including death of the fetus. Your doctor may discuss alternatives to help lower your cholesterol.

risks_warnings.title: Urinary tract infections
risks_warnings.description: People on Atorvastatin have reported getting urinary tract infections more often. Talk to your doctor if you develop burning or pain while urinating.

description_processed.orig: People on Atorvastatin have reported getting urinary tract infections more often. Talk to your doctor if you develop burning or pain while urinating.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk of colds and flu
risks_warnings.description: People on Atorvastatin have reported getting colds or flu more often. Talk to your doctor if this bothers you.

description_processed.orig: People on Atorvastatin have reported getting colds or flu more often. Talk to your doctor if this bothers you.

carousel_items: Lowers bad cholesterol and triglycerides, and raises good cholesterol.
Most people reach their target cholesterol levels in 4 to 6 weeks.
Avoid grapefruit and grapefruit juice while taking this medicine.
Tell your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, fever, or weakness.
Tell your doctor if you notice dark urine or yellowing of the eyes or skin.
Certain medications can interact with this drug. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist.

basics.benefits_moa: Simvastatin is cholesterol-lowering medicine called a statin. It lowers the amount of cholesterol your body makes, which helps lower "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and raise "good" cholesterol (HDL).
basics.bottom_line: Simvastatin is a good medication to improve your cholesterol. Statin side effects can be difficult to deal with, but the benefits might outweigh the risks.
downsides: Statins can cause digestive problems, blood sugar problems, muscle aches and stiffness, muscle injury, kidney damage, and liver damage. Some people have to stop taking this medicine because of these problems.

You're at higher risk for these side effects if you are female, are 65 years or older, drink alcohol every day, take more than one medicine for cholesterol, or have liver disease, kidney disease, or diabetes.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

downsides_processed.orig: Statins can cause digestive problems, blood sugar problems, muscle aches and stiffness, muscle injury, kidney damage, and liver damage. Some people have to stop taking this medicine because of these problems.

You're at higher risk for these side effects if you are female, are 65 years or older, drink alcohol every day, take more than one medicine for cholesterol, or have liver disease, kidney disease, or diabetes.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

upsides: Lowers "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and triglycerides (fats) and raises "good" cholesterol (HDL) in people who have trouble doing this through diet and exercise.
Can lower the risk of heart attack, stroke, and death, particularly if you have diabetes, high blood pressure, obesity, or a history of smoking.

upsides_processed.orig: Lowers "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and triglycerides (fats) and raises "good" cholesterol (HDL) in people who have trouble doing this through diet and exercise.
Can lower the risk of heart attack, stroke, and death, particularly if you have diabetes, high blood pressure, obesity, or a history of smoking.

userStories.identifier: I have muscle aches, will try night dose

userStories.tip: I stopped taking it after I learned that people taking statins are more likely to develop diabetes
my numbers look better and I can only attribute those results to this drug. I did nothing differently.
take it at night to avoid any muscle aches.

drugs.name: Simvastatin

labeled_indications.indication: Heart protection for people with high risk

carousel_items_processed.orig: Lowers bad cholesterol and triglycerides, and raises good cholesterol.
Most people reach their target cholesterol levels in 4 to 6 weeks.
Avoid grapefruit and grapefruit juice while taking this medicine.
Tell your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, fever, or weakness.
Tell your doctor if you notice dark urine or yellowing of the eyes or skin.
Certain medications can interact with this drug. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist.

risks_warnings.title: Muscle pain
risks_warnings.description: There are rare cases of muscle damage leading to kidney failure in people taking Simvastatin. The risk is greater in people with kidney disease or thyroid disease, are older and female and taking certain cholesterol-lowering medication combinations. Tell your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, weakness or fever and there is no known cause.
risk_factors: Combining Simvastatin with certain cholesterol-lowering drugs

description_processed.orig: There are rare cases of muscle damage leading to kidney failure in people taking Simvastatin. The risk is greater in people with kidney disease or thyroid disease, are older and female and taking certain cholesterol-lowering medication combinations. Tell your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, weakness or fever and there is no known cause.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: There are reports of liver damage in people who take Simvastatin, especially if they are heavy alcohol drinkers or have a history of liver disease. If you notice dark urine or yellowing of the eyes or skin, tell your doctor. Your doctor may also want to check your liver function periodically.

description_processed.orig: There are reports of liver damage in people who take Simvastatin, especially if they are heavy alcohol drinkers or have a history of liver disease. If you notice dark urine or yellowing of the eyes or skin, tell your doctor. Your doctor may also want to check your liver function periodically.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Don't use while pregnant it can harm your unborn baby. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

description_processed.orig: Don't use while pregnant it can harm your unborn baby. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

risks_warnings.title: Drug interactions
risks_warnings.description: Combining certain medications can increase the risk of muscle pain (myopathy), muscle damage (rhabdomyolysis) and kidney damage. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist when taking any new medications.
risk_factors: Certain drugs can increase the dose of Simvastatin in the body

description_processed.orig: Combining certain medications can increase the risk of muscle pain (myopathy), muscle damage (rhabdomyolysis) and kidney damage. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist when taking any new medications.

risks_warnings.title: High blood sugar
risks_warnings.description: Simvastatin can increase fasting (short-term) and HbA1c (long-term) blood sugar levels. Your doctor may need to check your blood sugar levels periodically.

description_processed.orig: Simvastatin can increase fasting (short-term) and HbA1c (long-term) blood sugar levels. Your doctor may need to check your blood sugar levels periodically.
